page.title: 12Hendon Rd. in the 1930's 2
page.content: {CONT from page 11 } The corner shop sold nearly everything from clothes to food.They ran clubs so that people could pay so much a week for the goods. There was a school called Hendon Board School.There were about 50 children in each class.The clssroom windows were high up so that the children would not be distracted by things that were happening outside.The walls were tiled.The classrooms were very dull. Today Hendon Road has changed.Shops and houses have gone.They have been replaced by factories and blocks of flats.From a bustling road of the 1930's it is now quiet except for workers going to the factories.
